author: EXM7777
text:
here are 5 gemini deep-research techniques that feel illegal but arenâ€™t:

1. run a search on every fiverr gig in your niche, export the titles, packages and upsells into a spreadsheet and you instantly see where you can slot your own offer without guessing on rates

2. scrape six months of reddit threads and micro-blog posts for your keyword, drop it into an LLM and ask it to list the most upvoted pain points and questions

3. feed the top 50 serp results for your target keyword into an SEO tool, pull the headings, word count and featured snippets, then let an AI summarize the common structure so you can get article outlines that will rank

4. use a page-archiver to save the highest-trafficked landing pages, email sequences and social posts in your niche, strip out the generic branding and file the angles by emotion to build your swipe file of great copy

5. drop the name or company of any potential partner into a background-check search, pull court records, news mentions and social footprints (this one's highly underrated)
